intro: Cleistes latiplume, commonly known as the broad-leafed cleistes, is a flowering plant belonging to the Oenotheraceae family. It is characterized by its delicate, urn-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Cleistes latiplume is native to parts of North America, particularly in the southeastern United States. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in woodland areas.
